description: Adding the cauliflower to the quinoa during the last five minutes of cooking softens it very slightly without making it lose its crunch; if you prefer it raw, just skip that step.
name: Random Act of Quinoa Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 bell pepper (red, green, purple, yellow, or combination, chopped)
1 zucchini (halved lengthwise and sliced into 1/4-inch pieces)
about 1/3 cup of your favorite dressing or Orange-Curry Dressing

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the quinoa, water, and garlic in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and cook covered for 10 minutes. Add the cauliflower and check to see that there is still water in the quinoa; if not, add 2 tablespoons of water. Cover and cook on low for 5 minutes, or until water is absorbed and quinoa is tender.

Put the quinoa/cauliflower into a large serving bowl and add the zucchini and bell peppers. (If you are using a pre-made salad dressing, add it now, just enough to moisten; refrigerate until chilled and add mango just before serving.)
